My dear Dr Kelly:
div1.p:
There has just been brought to my attention, information regarding the condition of
John R Kissenger, the first volunteer in the yellow fever research under Dr Walter
Reed, and I think that you will want to know about the situation.

Mr Kissenger is now living in a little house at Andrews (Huntington County), Indiana,
with inadequate income, and incapable of doing more than occasional low-grade work,
such as helping his wife with the wash or puttering around the garden.

It seems that he had been forced to move from his previous home in Michigan and to lose
part of his pension because he had antagonized many of his neighbors through his in-
sistence upon the honest enforcement of the Volstead Act.

While it may never be established that Mr Kissenger's nervous troubles are in any way
related to the yellow fever acquired in the course of the experiment, and while there
seems to be lack of unanimity in this country as to the desirability of enforcing all
our laws without discrimination, it seems to me that there ought to be enough interest
and resources available in this country to ensure Mr Kissenger against worry and the
serious discomfort to which he is now subjected. I have looked over some of Mr Kissenger's
correspondence over a period of years, and they all breathe the same spirit as that
manifested at the time when Major Reed saluted the volunteers for their devoted accept-
ance of the risks of the experiment and refusal to consider monetary compensation.
There is no note of complaint and yet his condition has been precarious aside from his
physical suffering for many years.

I am writing to ask what you think ought to be done to relieve the situation - and who
ought to do it. I am assuming that it is futile to wait for Congressional action, both
because of the delay this would involve, and because of the disgraceful record that our
Congress has made for itself in the past in connection with this case. Please let me
hear from you as soon as possible.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, Benj C Gruenberg
Managing Director BCG:MJ
